job_details.Vacaturetitel: Big Data Engineer for AI Training
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Outlier helps the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?
       We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.
       About the opportunity:
          + Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
          + This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you
       You may contribute your expertise by…
          + Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
          + Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
       Examples of desirable expertise
job_details.full_text:
Big Data Engineer for AI Training

Outlier helps the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?
       We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.
       About the opportunity:
          + Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
          + This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you
       You may contribute your expertise by…
          + Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
          + Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
       Examples of desirable expertise

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on using AI models to generate content and evaluating that content, rather than building, training, or deploying AI models. It lacks the core technical responsibilities of an ML or GenAI Engineer.

job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly relates to the process of training machine learning or generative AI models, which falls under the Modeling task category.

job_tasks.phrase: help train AI large language models
job_tasks.justification: This specifies the type of models being trained (LLMs) and the action of training, fitting the Modeling task.

job_tasks.phrase: help train generative artificial intelligence models
job_tasks.justification: Similar to the above, this phrase indicates involvement in the training of generative AI models, a core aspect of the Modeling task.

job_tasks.phrase: Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
job_tasks.justification: This describes a method of data generation or annotation used to train AI models, which is a precursor or component of the Modeling task.

job_tasks.phrase: Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
job_tasks.justification: While evaluation can be part of modeling, in this context, it's more about assessing the output of already trained models rather than the core model building or training process itself. However, it's closely related to the feedback loop for model improvement.

soft_skills.phrase: no requirement for previous AI experience
soft_skills.justification: This implies that the role is open to individuals who can learn and adapt to working with AI models, even without prior experience.

soft_skills.phrase: lend your coding expertise to train AI models
soft_skills.justification: This suggests a proactive use of existing skills (coding expertise) to contribute to a specific goal (training AI models), implying a degree of ownership and initiative.
